1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Decimal functions.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Decimal.Fraction
6  ( -- * Part of decimals
7    -- ** Integer and fraction
8    decimalIntPart, decimalFracPart,
9    decimalIntFrac,
10    -- ** Numerator and denominator
11    decimalNum, decimalDenom,
12
13    -- * Conver to integer
14    -- ** Round
15    decimalRound, decimalRoundAt, decimalRoundPer,
16    -- ** Round to even
17    decimalRoundEven, decimalRoundEvenAt, decimalRoundEvenPer,
18    -- ** Truncate
19    decimalTrunc, decimalTruncAt, decimalTruncPer,
20    decimalTruncError,
21    -- ** Round out
22    decimalRoundOut, decimalRoundOutAt, decimalRoundOutPer,
23    -- ** Floor
24    decimalFloor, decimalFloorAt, decimalFloorPer,
25    -- ** Ceil
26    decimalCeil, decimalCeilAt, decimalCeilPer,
27    -- ** Other
28    chopDigitsTrancate,
29    chopDigitsRound,
30    roundLastDigit,
31  ) where
32
33import qualified Data.Ratio                                  as R
34import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture                    as O
35import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Decimal.Decimal   as D
36import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Decimal.Rational  as D
37
38
39-- --------------------------------------------  Part
40
41-- ----------------------  Integer and fraction
42
43-- | Integer part of decimal.
44decimalIntPart :: O.Map D.Decimal
45decimalIntPart = fst . decimalIntFrac
46
47-- | Fractional part of decimal.
48decimalFracPart :: O.Map D.Decimal
49decimalFracPart = snd . decimalIntFrac
50
51-- | Integer and fractional parts of decimal.
52--
53--   >>> decimalIntFrac $ D.realDecimal 2 (4.5 :: Double)
54--   (Decimal (2) 4, Decimal (2) 0 + 1 % 2)
55--
56decimalIntFrac :: D.Decimal -> (D.Decimal, D.Decimal)
57decimalIntFrac d = (dec $ i D.%% 1, dec f) where
58    (i, f) = properFraction $ D.decimalRatio d
59    dec r  = D.decimalRatioMap (const r) d
60
61-- ----------------------  Numerator and denominator
62
63-- | Numerator part of decimal number.
64decimalNum :: D.Decimal -> D.DecimalInteger
65decimalNum = R.numerator . D.decimalRatio
66
67-- | Denominator part of decimal number.
68decimalDenom :: D.Decimal -> D.DecimalInteger
69decimalDenom = R.denominator . D.decimalRatio
70
71
72-- --------------------------------------------  Round
73
74updateDecimal :: D.Decimal -> D.DecimalFracle -> D.DecimalRatio -> D.Decimal
75updateDecimal d l r = d { D.decimalFracle = l
76                        , D.decimalRatio  = r }
77
78-- ----------------------  Round
79
80-- | Round decimal per self fractional length.
81decimalRound :: O.Map D.Decimal
82decimalRound d@D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = r } =
83    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioRoundAt l r
84
85-- | Round decimal per fractional length.
86decimalRoundAt :: O.Bin D.Decimal
87decimalRoundAt D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = l }
88             d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
89    let l' = fst $ properFraction l
90    in updateDecimal d l' $ D.ratioRoundAt l' r
91
92-- | Round decimal per unit decimal.
93decimalRoundPer :: O.Bin D.Decimal
94decimalRoundPer D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = per }
95              d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
96    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioRoundPer per r
97
98-- ----------------------  Round to even
99
100-- | Round decimal to even per self fractional length.
101decimalRoundEven :: O.Map D.Decimal
102decimalRoundEven d@D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = r } =
103    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioRoundEvenAt l r
104
105-- | Round decimal to even per fractional length.
106decimalRoundEvenAt :: O.Bin D.Decimal
107decimalRoundEvenAt D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = l }
108                 d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
109    let l' = fst $ properFraction l
110    in updateDecimal d l' $ D.ratioRoundEvenAt l' r
111
112-- | Round decimal to even per unit decimal.
113decimalRoundEvenPer :: O.Bin D.Decimal
114decimalRoundEvenPer D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = per }
115                  d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
116    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioRoundEvenPer per r
117
118-- ----------------------  Truncate
119
120-- | Truncate decimal per self fractional length.
121decimalTrunc :: O.Map D.Decimal
122decimalTrunc d@D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = r } =
123    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioTruncAt l r
124
125-- | Truncate decimal per fractional length.
126decimalTruncAt :: O.Bin D.Decimal
127decimalTruncAt D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = l }
128             d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
129    let l' = fst $ properFraction l
130    in updateDecimal d l' $ D.ratioTruncAt l' r
131
132-- | Truncate decimal per unit decimal.
133decimalTruncPer :: O.Bin D.Decimal
134decimalTruncPer D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = per }
135              d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
136    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioTruncPer per r
137
138-- | Truncation error of decimal.
139decimalTruncError :: O.Map D.Decimal
140decimalTruncError d@D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = r } =
141    updateDecimal d (l + 1) (r `D.ratioRem` D.ratioFracle l)
142
143-- ----------------------  Round out
144
145-- | Round out (toward infinity) decimal to even per self fractional length.
146decimalRoundOut :: O.Map D.Decimal
147decimalRoundOut d@D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = r } =
148    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioRoundOutAt l r
149
150-- | Round out (toward infinity) decimal to even per fractional length.
151decimalRoundOutAt :: O.Bin D.Decimal
152decimalRoundOutAt D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = l }
153                 d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
154    let l' = fst $ properFraction l
155    in updateDecimal d l' $ D.ratioRoundOutAt l' r
156
157-- | Round out (toward infinity) decimal to even per unit decimal.
158decimalRoundOutPer :: O.Bin D.Decimal
159decimalRoundOutPer D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = per }
160                  d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
161    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioRoundOutPer per r
162
163-- ----------------------  Floor
164
165-- | Floor decimal per self fractional length.
166decimalFloor :: O.Map D.Decimal
167decimalFloor d@D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = r } =
168    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioFloorAt l r
169
170-- | Floor decimal per fractional length.
171decimalFloorAt :: O.Bin D.Decimal
172decimalFloorAt D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = l }
173             d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
174    let l' = fst $ properFraction l
175    in updateDecimal d l' $ D.ratioFloorAt l' r
176
177-- | Floor decimal per unit decimal.
178decimalFloorPer :: O.Bin D.Decimal
179decimalFloorPer D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = per }
180              d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
181    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioFloorPer per r
182
183-- ----------------------  Ceil
184
185-- | Ceiling decimal per self fractional length.
186decimalCeil :: O.Map D.Decimal
187decimalCeil d@D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = r } =
188    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioCeilAt l r
189
190-- | Ceiling decimal per fractional length.
191decimalCeilAt :: O.Bin D.Decimal
192decimalCeilAt D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = l }
193             d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
194    let l' = fst $ properFraction l
195    in updateDecimal d l' $ D.ratioCeilAt l' r
196
197-- | Ceiling decimal per unit decimal.
198decimalCeilPer :: O.Bin D.Decimal
199decimalCeilPer D.Decimal { D.decimalFracle = l, D.decimalRatio = per }
200              d@D.Decimal { D.decimalRatio = r } =
201    updateDecimal d l $ D.ratioCeilPer per r
202
203-- ----------------------  Other
204
205-- | @chopDigitsTrancate@ /d/ /n/ returns a number
206--   which does not have the tailing /d/ digits.
207--   If /d/ is zero or negative, it returns just /n/.
208chopDigitsTrancate :: (Integral d, Integral n) => d -> n -> n
209chopDigitsTrancate d n = fst $ chopDigits d n
210
211-- | @chopDigitsRound@ is similar to 'chopDigitsTrancate',
212--   but rounds chopped digit.
213chopDigitsRound :: (Integral d, Integral n) => d -> n -> n
214chopDigitsRound d n =
215  case chopDigits d n of
216   (n', True)   -> n' + 1
217   (n', False)  -> n'
218
219chopDigits :: (Integral d, Integral n) => d -> n -> (n, Bool)
220chopDigits d n
221  | d <= 0     = (n, False)
222  | otherwise  = (sig * q, r >= half)
223  where
224    sig        = signum n
225    divisor    = 10 ^ d
226    half       = divisor `quot` 2
227    (q, r)     = abs n `quotRem` divisor
228
229-- | Round the last (least significant) digit.
230roundLastDigit :: (Integral n) => n -> n
231roundLastDigit n = sig * n' where
232  sig = signum n
233  a   = abs n
234  n'  = case a `rem` 10 of
235         r | r >= 5     -> a - r + 10
236           | otherwise  -> a - r
237
